PointerEventAltitudeAngle.summary:
The altitudeAngle read-only property of the interface represents the angle between a transducer (a pointer or stylus) axis and the X-Y plane of a device screen.
The altitude angle describes whether the transducer is perpendicular to the screen, parallel, or at some angle in between.

remarks.para: Depending on the specific hardware and platform, user agents will likely only receive one set of values for the transducer orientation relative to the screen plane — either and or altitudeAngle and .

para.see: The azimuth angle of a pointer compared to the altitude angle

remarks.para: For an additional illustration of this property, see Figure 4 in the specification.

PointerEventAltitudeAngle.value:
An angle in radians between 0 and π/2 where 0 is parallel to the device surface (X-Y plane), and π/2 is perpendicular to the surface.
Defaults to π/2 (perpendicular to the surface) which differs from the altitudeAngle in touch events which defaults to 0 (parallel to the surface).
For hardware and platforms that do not report tilt or angle, the value is π/2.
